intro: Senecio kunturinus, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio kunturinus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
